intro: Pseudabutilon callimorphum, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
